task_summary: Robot arm identifies and grasps an orange fruit from a table using visual localization, approach, and grasp actions.

task_long_description.overview: This episode documents the robotic arm executing a pick task to acquire an orange from a table. The arm uses visual feedback to locate the orange among other objects (e.g., an apple, a green fruit, and cubes), approaches above, computes a suitable grasp, aligns to the fruit, and successfully grasps it. Steps progress from perception to grasp confirmation, with all actions visible across 9 chronologically arranged frames.
preconditions: Orange is present on the table and unoccluded.
Robot gripper starts open and unoccupied.
stepwise_plan: Verify visibility of the orange; retry scan if not found.
Detect orange and estimate its pose.
Move to a position above the orange (top-down approach).
Approach and align to the grasp pose.
Confirm orange is in the gripper.
success_criteria: Orange is securely held by the gripper at the end.
No collision or fruit displacement occurs prior to grasp.
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: retry scan up to 3 times.
Grasp fails: run sequence again if permissible.
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when orange is confirmed to be in the gripper or after failure recovery exceeds allowed attempts.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if orange is detected in the scene.
Scans for orange using raster scan, up to 3 attempts.
Visually detects and localizes the orange.
Moves end-effector above the orange (10cm overhead).
Computes grasp pose using top-down approach and stores as 'grasp_orange'.
Robot arm approaches and aligns above orange with 5mm tolerance.
Executes grasp at computed pose using top strategy.
Checks if orange is held by gripper.

failure_modes: Gripper fails to close or slips
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for orange up to 3 times
Abort if detection or grasp fails repeatedly
assumptions: Frames clearly depict a top-down pick of an orange (not any transfer or placement).
The 'orange' is the orange-colored sphere next to an apple and a green fruit on the table.
No explicit force parameter is visible or required in this episode; the grasp action suffices.
No placing action is required as per the frames; only the pick is executed.
If instruction implied a full pick-and-place, this episode only captures the pick.
Action ports and strategies are inferred for directness and minimal context from visuals.

expected_success_criteria: At the last annotated frame, the orange is confirmed visually as in the gripper.
